intro: Virgulus moranensis, commonly known as the Moran's virgulus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white ray florets. Native to specific regions of South America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. The plant is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
